title: Chursina wins Vuelta a Burgos stage 2 as Chabbey takes over race lead
content:
What seemed like a doomed breakaway turned into a dream come true for Anastasiia Chursina who won the second stage of the Vuelta a Burgos Feminas. Amalie Dideriksen (Trek-Segafredo) won the bunch sprint to take second on the stage ahead of Alice Barnes (Canyon-SRAM) in third. Elise Chabbey (Canyon-SRAM) finished ahead of Grace Brown (Team BikeExchange) and took over the race lead ahead of stage 3.

A break of three was up against an active peloton with 25 km to go. A crash with 23 km to go created a split in the peloton with a handful of favourites finding themselves distanced from the peloton. Anna van der Breggen and three of her SD Worx teammates tried to extend their distance from the peloton.

Out front Anastasiia Chursina (Alé BTC Ljubljana) fought to remain ahead of the peloton behind without her two breakaway companions. The race behind came back together, with Team BikeExchange working to keep the race leader Brown at the head of the race.

Inside 1 km to go Chursina led the race by over a minute, with Canyon-SRAM and SD Worx chasing down the lone rider. Dideriksen won the sprint for second with Barnes taking third on the day.

Vuelta a Burgos Feminas (2.WWT) Pedrosa de Valdeporres → Villarcayo
author: Abby Mickey
